description: 20%). Proteins with previous links to neurodegeneration such as tau, SOD1 and PARK7 differed most strongly by AD status, providing strong positive controls for our approach. CSF proteome changes in Alzheimerâ€™s disease prove to be widespread and often correlated with tau concentrations. Our unbiased screen also reveals a consistent glycolytic signature across our and a recent report (bioRxiv.org doi.org/10.1101/806752). Successful reclassification of individual patients and a machine learning model suggests clinical utility of our proteomic signature.
